title: A dichotomy theorem for nonuniform CSPs simplified
abstract:
Abstract
In a non-uniform Constraint Satisfaction problem CSP​(Γ)CSPΓ{\rm CSP}(\Gamma), where ΓΓ\Gamma
is a set of relations on a finite set A𝐴A, the goal is
to find an assignment of values to variables subject to constraints imposed
on specified sets of variables using the relations from ΓΓ\Gamma.
The Dichotomy Conjecture for the non-uniform CSP states that for every
constraint language ΓΓ\Gamma the problem CSP​(Γ)CSPΓ{\rm CSP}(\Gamma) is either solvable in
polynomial time or is NP-complete. It was proposed by Feder and Vardi
in their seminal 1993 paper. In this paper we confirm the Dichotomy
Conjecture.
